docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Curing the System,'' by Atul Gawande (column, May 10): There is even a simpler system than the Massachusetts-style reform discussed by Dr. Gawande. That proposal introduces economic burdens for the new system while maintaining those of the old.
docs.abstract: Dr Richard Margolese letter, prompted by May 10 Atul Gawande Op-Ed article on universal health care, argues private insurance companies should not be part of health care coverage solution as they are large part of problem; Dr Fikry B Salib letter on on May 12 Gawande Op-Ed article finds thought of counterfeit or substandard drugs and devices to be horrifying; Dr Bob Friedlander letter says practicing physicians have no control over whether counterfeit drugs and devices sneak into system
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Re ''Curing the System,'' by Atul Gawande (column, May 10):     There is even a simpler system than the Massachusetts-style reform discussed by Dr. Gawande. That proposal introduces economic burdens for the new system while...

docs.lead_paragraph: Amgen shares were battered again yesterday after Medicare proposed to sharply curtail reimbursement for the company's biggest selling product, the anemia drug Aranesp. Some analysts said the proposed restrictions, announced late Monday, could cut use of the drug by as much as half. But the Medicare effort is likely to face opposition from some doctors and patient groups, who say such drugs help cancer patients cope with chemotherapy.

headline.main: Shares of Anemia Drug Makers Slide as Medicare Threatens to Cut Reimbursement

docs.abstract: Amgen shares are battered after Medicare proposes to sharply curtail reimbursement for company's biggest selling product, anemia drug Aranesp; some analysts say proposed restrictions could cut use of drug by as much as half; Medicare effort is likely to face opposition from some doctors and patient groups, who say such drugs help cancer patients cope with chemotherapy; proposals, which would also apply to Johnson & Johnson's anemia drug Procrit follow recent reports suggesting that drugs, widely used to treat anemia in cancer patients, could actually be making tumors worse or hastening deaths; Food and Drug Administration advisory committee last week recommended restrictions on use of drugs (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to Bob Herbert's May 15 column, "The Right to Paid Sick Days."
docs.abstract: Readers respond to Bob Herbert's May 15 column, "The Right to Paid Sick Days." Michael Rodemer, Ann Arbor, Mich.: I just used the Cracker Barrel Web site to send my outrage over the company's sick leave policy to whomever has to read customer complaints. I can only hope my complaint gets passed up the line. [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: The decline in American women who get annual mammograms is disturbing because it means that more women will fail to get the early detection that increases their chances of survival.
